thread.title: Oman picks four players for Nomura Cup
thread.title_full: Oman picks four players for Nomura Cup

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: Oman picks four players for Nomura Cup
text:
Oman picks four players for Nomura Cup Rashad al Harthy Muscat Daily staff writer October 14, 2015 
Top-ranked golfer Azaan al Rumhy, along with Ali Hameed, Hamed al Rumhy and Rashad al Harthy, will represent Oman when it makes its debut at the forthcoming 27th Nomura Cup, one of the worldâ€™s most prestigious amateur team golf championships, in Abu Dhabi, UAE from October 22-25. 
Mundhir al Barwani, the chairman of the Oman Golf Committee (OGC) will head the delegation, while Ahmed al Jhdhamy, the OGC vice-chairman, will accompany the team as its manager at the tournament. 
A total of 27 countries will vie for the top honours at the event, which is being held in the region for the first time. 
The Nomura Cup began in 1963 as a tri-nation tournament in the Philippines when the host nation took on Japan and China. Today, there are 39 member countries affiliated to the Asia Pacific Golf Confederation, the organiser of the competition. 
The biennial tournament has been dominated over the past by Australia, which has won the title a record ten times, and Japan, which is a seven-time winner. 
The Australians successfully defended their title at the 2013 Nomura Cup at Santiburi Country Club in Thailand and they are expected to field another strong team, along with contenders Japan, China and South Korea. Similar content
